channel.title: Add an octave up and/or down
channel.description:
I thought it would be easy - but I constantly fail.
This is what I want to do:
Take the incoming midi signal (I use the midi/ctrl/mpe pitch/including pitch bend output) and shift it an octave up or down before sending it to another osc in my patch.
So far I tried to multiply it, add it to itself and others, but it never gives a safe solution.
Any suggestions. Would be great.

item.title: Add an octave up and/or down
item.dc:creator: @janvantomme Jan Vantomme
item.description:
@janvantomme wrote:

Made an object that shifts the incoming signal an octave up/down, inspired by the Ableton Live "Random" MIDI Effect.

Janvantomme contributions

jv/conv/pitch-randomizer [image] Status active Version 1.0.12 Description Object inspired by the Ableton Live Random MIDI Effect. Use the number box to set a percentage. In the help patch, this is set to 40. This means that there is a 40% probability that the output will be a different note. The radio buttons set the mode. Output is the same as the input, nothing changes. There's a 40% chance that the output will be one octave up. There's a 40% chance that the output will be oneâ€¦

Read full topic
item.source: Add an octave up and/or down

item.title: Add an octave up and/or down
item.dc:creator: @Hugo
item.description:
@Hugo wrote:

I needed this for my synth in the past and had written an object. I publish it on this occasion:

Hugo Contributions

hug/math/octaveShift.axo A simple math module, that is useful for octave shifting. The two trigger inputs can be used to scale up and down. The result will have a corresponding output like ... -12. 0, +12. +24... Simply add this to the midi note signal that you want to shift. The trigger output is active when both input triggers are active. So you can trigger something else by pressing both buttons at the same time.

Read full topic
item.source: Add an octave up and/or down

item.title: Add an octave up and/or down
item.dc:creator: @axosynth
item.description:
@axosynth wrote:

So do you think this also works?
Depending on the pitch of the incoming signal the pitch is adjustable several octaves up or down (different usage: thus I can either play on the very left or right end of my keyboard and send it to the axoloti)

grafik.png771x469 20.2 KB

item.title: Add an octave up and/or down
item.dc:creator: @Sputnki Filippo Tamagnini
item.description:
@Sputnki wrote:

  • 12 for one octave up, +24 for two octaves up, -12 for one octave down, -24 for two octaves down. You can use jaffa's patch to generate multiples of 12 and add that number to your midi input

Read full topic
